Module schiffeversenken
Package de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine

Class SmartScene<Model>

java.lang.Object
de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine.Scene
de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine.SmartScene<Model>
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameScene
public class SmartScene<Model> extends Scene
While a scene object is a low level interface to the graphics stack it lacks some convenience. Most notably it isn't split into a View and Controller. This intermediate class aims to fix this issue.
Author:
leondietrich

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SmartScene(View<Model> v, Controller<Model> c)
    Use this to create a more flexible scene (SmartScene) that's split into a View and Controller.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw(Canvas c, Vec2 mouseLocation)
      Description copied from class: Scene
      This method gets called when ever the application decides that it needs to redraw the screen. Use this method to implement your scene rendering.
      Specified by:
      draw in class Scene
      Parameters:
      c - The canvas to draw on
      mouseLocation - The current position of the mouse cursor relative to the canvas

    • attach

      public void attach()
      Description copied from class: Scene
      This method will be called when the scene becomes visible. Use it to set up (or reset) your scene in order to be nice.
      Specified by:
      attach in class Scene

    • update

      public void update(long milis)
      Description copied from class: Scene
      This method gets called prior to rendering. Use it in order to update anything that needs to be updated multiple times a second.
      Specified by:
      update in class Scene
      Parameters:
      milis - Time since the last invoking of update

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(char key, boolean shift, boolean alt, boolean ctrl, boolean down, boolean up, boolean left, boolean right)
      Description copied from class: Scene
      Use this method in order to receive newly pressed keys
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in class Scene
      Parameters:
      key - The pressed key
      shift - Was the shift modifier pressed?
      alt - Was the ALT modifier pressed?
      ctrl - Was the CTRL modifier pressed?
      down - Was the down arrow key pressed?
      up - Was the up arrow key pressed?
      left - Was the left arrow key pressed?
      right - Was the right arrow key pressed?
